programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys check out a Second World War Morse Code reader and a letter written by John Quincy Adams. Plus, Corey bravely takes over the annual Independence Day barbecue.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick sizes up a signed print of a famous Ansel Adams photograph, and the shop attempts to cash in on a 1791 one cent coin.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team fixes up a 19th-century cannon and a 1960s slot machine from a hotel casino.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores a large marquee and repairs a 1948 vending machine that was damaged in a hurricane.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his crew struggle to rescue a trailer from a dangerous bridge. Plus, a crash involving many vehicles proves deadly for a Good Samaritan. Documentary following the work of a heavy rescue team patroling the roads of Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator returns with Daniel Browning Smith for another series focusing on people with seemingly super-human abilities. The first episode features a man who does not feel pain, and is able to hang steel bars from his eyelids.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of the notorious South Side Rapist, who terrorised St Louis in the early 1990s, and kept the authorities guessing as to his identity for years.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams focus on classic British motors as they strip the most valuable parts off a Rolls-Royce and a Jaguar Sovereign. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine 'the promised land', which is considered the most sacred place on Earth. However, it has also been carved up and fought over for thousands of years.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine the many ancient Jewish and Christian documents that did not make it into the Bible, exploring why they were excluded.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging the iconic KA-BAR military blade using only tiny cubes of W-1 steel. The two remaining competitors have five days in their forges to recreate the battle-tested Glaive Guisarme.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to forge a multipurpose weapon from old rescue tools. Blades that can cut, pry and hammer are then put through a brutal round of testing. After narrowly escaping elimination, two smiths head back to their home forges to recreate a unique utilitarian tool, the Russian Pioneer sword.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les tells a frightening story of a hold-up at his grandfather's store, and a dominatrix brings her gear into the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba, Kenny and Matt compete fiercely over the bargains on offer at an auction in Forth Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go to Waxahachie, where Jenny makes a scandalous discovery that could prove very profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: While Kenny and Matt bicker over a tool-rich locker in DeSoto, Mary bags a purchase that sparks a trip to the oldest Italian restaurant in Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An auction in Mesquite brings back bad memories for Ricky and Bubba, and Mary makes a strange discovery that leads her to a llama farm.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Things get hairy in Henderson when an impromptu brawl breaks out among some of the bidders.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is offered an alternating-current motor invented by 19th-century pioneer Nikola Tesla, and a pair of trainers used in Back to the Future.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars fight for memorabilia from undefeated boxing champ Rocky Marciano, and Rick takes a look at a one-of-a-kind glow-in-the-dark car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey tries not to be a Scrooge when two first editions of A Christmas Carol appear in the shop, while Rick is rocked when a meteorite drops in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out two classic pinball machines, while Rick turns his attention to a carrier pigeon capsule from the First World War and decides to take up boxing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys check out a Second World War Morse Code reader and a letter written by John Quincy Adams. Plus, Corey bravely takes over the annual Independence Day barbecue.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick sizes up a signed print of a famous Ansel Adams photograph, and the shop attempts to cash in on a 1791 one cent coin.

programme.title: Hitler's Secret Tunnels
programme.desc: Seventy years after the end of the Second World War, hundreds of miles of tunnels built by the Nazis may still be protecting Hitler's final secrets. When explorers Mike Scott and Luke Mahoney uncover a hidden Nazi document that reveals a sealed Nazi underworld, they search these unexplored tunnel complexes that might hold the answers.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While an incredible new discovery is made at Smith's Cove, brothers Marty and Rick Lagina and their team make a find at the Money Pit that could be part of the fabled Oak Island treasure.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers face disaster when they are surrounded by a Simulant Death Ship and a fleet of Annihilators while hiding in an asteroid, and it is up to Arnold J Rimmer to save them. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Denise Lewis, Richard Osman, Robert Rinder and Katherine Ryan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the latest run of the comedy panel show. Featuring appearances by guests including David Baddiel, Ed Balls, Jo Brand, Steve Davis, Susie Dent, Ade Edmondson, Sheila Hancock, Stephen Mangan, Bob Mortimer, Ore Oduba, Anita Rani, Fay Ripley, Stacey Solomon, Jordan Stephens, Claudia Winkleman and Kimberly Wyatt.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Massive Dad, Russell Kane and Phil Wang are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: That's What Debt Actually Is, Actually
programme.desc: The comedian discusses a convoluted way of getting rid of an unwanted gift, reimagines a classic game show, and reveals how the diamond industry could be brought to its knees.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In the Jebel Akhdar mountain range of Oman, Steve leads an expedition into an unexplored desert canyon. With temperatures soaring, dehydration and heat stroke are a constant threat.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The 2018 edition of the series in which teams of amateur racers test out their homemade, gravity-powered soapboxes on obstacle-littered courses in Johannesburg, South Africa. The entrants create vehicles without engines and race downhill in this popular offbeat event.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than Â£1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear: From A-Z
programme.desc: John Bishop narrates an alphabetical romp through the series' most memorable stunts and features as former hosts Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May pushed vehicles of all shapes and sizes to their limits. With 22 seasons of the show, there was no shortage of material to choose from as the likes of Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz attempted to be the fastest Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and the presenters risked life and limb in their assorted globe-trotting adventures.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges, including playing ice hockey with Suzukis and what occurs if you ski-jump a rocket-powered Mini.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Intrepid gravity-fuelled Soapbox Racers take on Observatory Hill overlooking Helsinki Harbour. How will they handle the brutal berm, the car wash and the ferocious kickers?.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Unable to convince Lucy that he did not smash a blue and white antique vase that belonged to her grandmother, Lee summons the family to a meeting to flush out the culprit.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy takes the kids away to her parents while Lee stays in the house to oversee the building work being done their kitchen, but unfortunately the tradesman he has employed has an annoyingly relaxed attitude to deadlines. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Stand By Me (1986)
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Recalling a decade in British music, with archive performances from the early stages of the 'swingin' era, featuring music by by rock, pop and R'n'B artists including the Springfields, the Shadows, the Beatles and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: More pop, rock and rhythm and blues from the archives, featuring appearances by the Rolling Stones, the Dave Clark Five, the Seekers and the Byrds from 1964 and '65.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: A selection of archive footage from the arrival of the so-called beat boom in 1964, which catered to the art-school craze for rhythm and blues. Featuring performances by Tom Jones, the Kinks, Manfred Mann, the Rolling Stones, John Lee Hooker and the Pretty Things.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the Top of the Pops archives, featuring performances by acts including the Foundations, Procol Harum, the Bee Gees, the Rolling Stones, and Dave Dee, Dozy, Beaky, Mick and Tich.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Music from the flower power era, featuring bands including Herman's Hermits, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, the Alan Price Set, Manfred Mann and the Rolling Stones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A rising star in the Essex police force is found beaten and shot in his burnt-out car in what proves to be an emotional case for his colleagues. The team helps DCI Jim Sullivan, the detective charged with bringing the killer to justice, and it isn't long before suspicion falls on Dean Fallon - a local drug dealer and the son of a known crime boss. But when he proves to have a solid alibi, the investigation shifts closer to home. Starring Emilia Fox and David Caves, with James Alexandrou and Jason Watkins.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As all attempts to locate Abi Nixon prove fruitless, Sam begins to panic - could her daughter have been abducted, committed suicide or even faked her own death? Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny's sister causes havoc for Hugh and Ken when she visits Whyhope to defend Meryl against corruption charges. Betty uses her hidden talents to solve a medical mystery.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny makes a choice when Hugh and Toke turn up the romantic pressure. When Charlie is unfairly sacked by the Headmaster, Meryl resorts to blackmail to get her reinstated.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Christmas turns to misery for most of Blue Watch when Hallam is set on fire, Charisma discovers that Donna is selling dangerous toys, and Josie and Bayleaf end up in bed together.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Feature-length festive episode from 1992. A violent attack on an elderly Czech fighter pilot leads Lovejoy and Eric to hunt for missing diamonds in Prague, and the pair are soon joined by Jane, who was holidaying in Austria with friends. Meanwhile, Tinker is left to make preparations for Christmas. Guest starring Donald Pleasence, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: The Lady Vanishes
programme.desc: It is 1931 and socialite Iris Carr (Tuppence Middleton) is travelling back from a holiday in the Balkans, but faints on the platform of the railway station in the scorching heat. She is comforted by fellow passenger Miss Froy (Selina Cadell), but when Iris falls asleep she awakes to find the woman has disappeared and everyone else on board denies ever having seen her. With only handsome traveller Max Hare (Tom Hughes) for support, Iris maintains that Miss Froy has somehow been abducted - even though it increasingly appears to be a delusion on her part. Mystery, also starring Keeley Hawes, Gemma Jones, Stephanie Cole and Julian Rhind-Tutt. Adapted from Ethel Lina White's novel, The Wheel Spins.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Millionaire environmentalist and scientist Dan Hagen is shot on his boat while out at sea, and all the evidence points toward a robbery gone wrong, but DI Goodman suspects foul play by a crew member. The team soon realises the group are not as close-knit as they initially seem, and with everyone hiding a secret, the pressure is on to get to the bottom of how and why Dan was killed. The case gives the British detective a sudden desire to become a sailor, while Florence surprises the team with her action hero credentials. Caribbean crime drama, starring Kris Marshall and JosÃ©phine Jobert.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of a DJ leads Nikki to question her judgement in a strikingly similar case from her past and she brings the potential mistake to the attention of her colleagues, but the news threatens to have repercussions for the family of the deceased, the police and the Lyell Centre. The fresh evidence leads to the conclusion that a copycat killer is at large and Nikki finds evidence that an intruder has been entering her home. Feature-length episode of the drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Alex Crawford meets Islamic State members left behind in Syria, including children used as fighters, and Stuart Ramsay witnesses the end of Sudan's 30-year dictatorship.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Katherine and Anya make a determined push to get to the bottom of the Laura Fraser case once and for all, hatching a plan to get the DNA evidence they desperately need. Bancroft executes a massive sting operation against Athif Kamara, but things do not run smoothly and she is forced to reveal carefully kept secrets about her past. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, Faye Marsay and Amara Khan.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to Â£40,000. This week's teams are the Suits in the City from London and Team Samanda from the Wirral.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Kayo and John must stop the Chaos Crew from stealing a dangerous chemical from a global seed vault.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's challenge will see him attempt to escape from a helicopter simulator underwater. Has he got what it takes to be submerged?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit tries to be romantic, but his idea of what that means proves to be very different to Irma's. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: The Sara Cox Show
programme.sub-title: The Sara Cox Show at Christmas
programme.desc: Sara is joined by Emmerdale's Isabel Hodgins and Susan Cookson, actor Steve Pemberton and comedian Jayde Adams. There is also live music from Beverley Knight.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: The chef is back in the kitchen with festive food and guests including radio DJ Chris Evans, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page and Viscountess Emma Weymouth.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner reveal their take on classic festive dishes, including the perfect turkey, roast potatoes, and a classic Christmas cake.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha creates an American-themed meal with Christian Stevenson - aka DJ BBQ. On the menu are Maryland home fries for breakfast, buttermilk fried chicken for lunch, Christian's Smash Burger and tomato pie for dinner, with Nadia's Washington apple crisp for dessert.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a council clerk, Barnaby and Jones discover he was an expert blackmailer. A phone number on the dead man's blotter sends the duo to the seaside in search of his latest targets - whose boat trip could conceal a motive for the killing. Meanwhile, Joyce is convinced a local farmer knows more than he is telling. Julia McKenzie and Grant Masters guest star, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the comedian meets a Pyrenean mountain dog that has a problem with its bladder. Elsewhere, a dog suffering from skin problems needs surgery on its eyes, and Paul also helps a West Highland white terrier that is almost twice the weight it should be get into shape.

programme.title: Shrek (2001)
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which the Rev Kate Bottley, Dr Ranj Singh, Made in Chelsea's Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo and comedian Ed Byrne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a festive special of the game show from Manchester, where he sets members of the public unusual Christmas-themed challenges and unwraps a variety of hilarious games.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

credits.actor: Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007

programme.title: Basic Instinct (1992)
programme.desc: A hard-drinking San Francisco cop investigates the case of a man murdered with an ice-pick, but his normally well-honed intuition starts letting him down as he falls for the sultry and manipulative chief suspect, the victim's former girlfriend. Thriller from director Paul Verhoeven, starring Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, George Dzundza and Jeanne Tripplehorn.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of clogs, pasties and how planes are painted.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an XK8 Jaguar in poor condition, giving mechanic Edd China a tough challenge to fix it up within a tight budget.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Ed Byrne, the comedian supervises a general knowledge battle between the Spread Eagle from Croydon, south London, and the Foldgate Inn from Norfolk.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, beginning with collisions from highways around the world, including an unimaginable three-way accident.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: As hardwood supplies plummet, Bobby struggles to keep the mills afloat, and he decides to split the crew to maximise efficiency - but this master plan seems doomed to fail.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team sets out to help a man who dreams about having a Honda with all the extras.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini attempts to auction off a number of different vehicles to help him in his quest to obtain a 1911 Winton 17b.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A woman asks Wayne Carini to help sell her late husband's 1965 Shelby Cobra 427.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini gets a personal look at the last remaining original 1967 Ferrari 275 GTB/4 NART Spyders.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a look at the hottest parties happening at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The team tries out a range of new tests, new races and new motors from around the world. As well as meeting motoring legends, stars put top supercars through their paces.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The team try out a range of new tests, new races and new motors from around the world. As well as meeting motoring legends, they put top supercars through their paces.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson and Jason Plato take a day trip to France in the Ferrari 812 Superfast and Aston Martin DBS Superleggera. Plus, Jonny smith visits the Frankfurt Motor Show.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato and Jonny Smith face off in the series' first van versus pick-up challenge. The team tests the Cupra Ateca, the first car from Seat's sports division, and Jimmy Deville fits a custom exhaust..

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jason Plato and Karun Chandhok test two new sports SUVs, while Vicki Butler-Henderson checks out a 3.6l V6 turbocharged American muscle costing a cool Â£500,000 - the ultra-exclusive Ford GT.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Porsche 924 in an attempt to make it roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue their project to make a classic Porsche 924 fit for the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for Â£5,000, hoping Edd China will be able to work his magic on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, improving the roof seal and spraying it black. Mike Brewer then tries to maximise its price.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China are excited to get their hands on a Porsche 944 Turbo, but the restoration does not run smoothly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue to restore the Porsche 944 Turbo, using all their skills to overhaul the sports car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Porsche 914 in a barn and thinks he can turn a profit on the 1970s sports car. Edd China has the tricky job of restoring it to a saleable condition.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Porsche Boxster for Â£1,000 - despite it having seized brakes and mould on its roof. Expert mechanic Edd China tries to determine the cause of the faults so the pair can make the necessary repairs and trade it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Porsche 993 Targa to renovate, and finds the cheapest one in the country.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks out a Porsche 912E, and with help from Edd China, he aims to address the years of neglect and make a return on his investment.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a luxury fabric manufacturer in Suffolk, Drew Pritchard is impressed by historic silks once used in the royal household. Plus, in Scotland, he haggles with a young baron.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Action from the latest EFL fixtures, including Fulham v Leeds United, Cardiff City v Preston North End and West Bromwich Albion v Brentford.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Investigating a UFO crash that was believed to be a Soviet satellite. Plus, a probe sent to Mars discovers evidence of frozen water on the red planet.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Katie accepts an award in Dublin, tensions mount in her love life. With the prospect of bankruptcy looming, she recruits expert help to control her spending.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, after the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, DNA was traced to the bomber through the saliva that remained on the back of a mailing label.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Dalene Carlson. When she vanished one evening in August 2011, CCTV footage revealed several suspects, each with a motive. Jason Gilley later stood trial for kidnap, rape and murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 2011 murder of Melissa White, whose body was found in her backyard. When investigators took a closer look at the neighbours, they unearthed a secret and had to work out whether it could be connected with the killing.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: One year after the original crime, new clues emerge regarding the location of the suspects in an armed home invasion during which a police officer was shot.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Mark rescues a dog with open wounds from a crate and firefighters try to reach a cat stuck 40ft up a palm tree in fierce winds.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When Boris the Staffy was born he had a cleft palate, and Chris attempts a type of complex surgery that has never been performed in the country before to help save his life.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Brides-to-be Danielle and Kathryn want the same gown - and there's only one in the sale. Meanwhile, Jessica is in search of one very specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Second-time bride Becky hunts for a dress to make up for her disastrous first wedding, while Monica prepares to wed - four years after buying her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bodybuilder wants a dress that shows off her muscles, and a sporty bride is pressured into a more glamorous look.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a distressed wild bird that has been the victim of animal cruelty. Tim has an angry snapping turtle on his hands at the reptile park.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a young alpaca suffering from stress and shock after bushfires strike the Blue Mountains. Tim needs to track down a missing koala in the reptile park.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the weight-loss fortunes of Janine. A year into her journey, she is still struggling and running out of treatment options to get control of her eating habit quickly.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Holly already has a failed weight-loss surgery, so to succeed she needs to alter more than her eating habits. She also has to beat a childhood trauma still haunting her.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Holly already has a failed weight-loss surgery, so to succeed she needs to alter more than her eating habits. She also has to beat a childhood trauma still haunting her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Jordan is due to marry her childhood sweetheart and brings her mum, sister, and opinionated auntie along to find her perfect winter wonderland dress. British version of the reality show about bridal shops, set in an Essex boutique.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride brings her father with her when she chooses a wedding dress, while another customer realises that the time has finally come to tell her dad that she has a tattoo.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride chooses between two different styles of dress, while a customer wants a beaded gown with a lot of flashy decoration thrown in.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer brings her mother and sister with her to help choose a dress, and another bride does not know what she wants - but is very clear about what she does not like.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer brings her mother's Princess Diana-style 1980s wedding dress to the store to give the staff an idea what she wants, while another customer is planning a Twilight-themed wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A customer seeks a vintage look, while a bride who has tried on and rejected 50 dresses in other establishments hopes to finally find what she is looking for.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A woman disagrees with her 10-year-old daughter on what she should wear for her wedding, while another customer wants a completely different look to her sister's bridal ball gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress for a traditional Greek wedding, while a customer hopes her gown will show off how much weight she has lost - but is upset by how she looks in it.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Rule-breaking brides visit Confetti & Lace, as blue-haired bride Stephanie wants a dress with colour and Virginia brings her fiance to help choose a gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride determined to stay within a strict budget is drawn to the most expensive dresses, while another customer insists that money is no object.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo makes an attempt to reunite a couple with their young daughter, whose life was cut short by Crohn's disease.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Big surprises unfold as Theresa Caputo hits the road again to surprise fans in Texas with readings.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Cameras catch up with Laura, whose collecting has spiralled into a compulsion that has left the relationships with her two sons on the brink of collapse.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: The case of six-year-old beauty queen JonBenet Ramsey, who was found murdered in her home in 1996. Police considered whether she was killed in a kidnapping-gone-wrong, by a home intruder. or by one of her own family.

programme.title: The Lost Women of NXIVM
programme.desc: An in-depth investigation into the four women members of Keith Raniere's NXIVM cult, whose members either vanished or died in mysterious circumstances.
